meanings.definition: Consisting of similar or identical elements
meanings.sent1: The homogenies colors of the flowers created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen had a homogenies look with all white cabinets and countertops.
meanings.sent3: The homogenies cupcakes at the party were a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her voice blended with the choir in a homogenies way, creating a harmonious sound.
meanings.sent5: The artist used homogenies shades of blue to paint a serene landscape.

meanings.definition: To make uniform or similar in composition
meanings.sent1: She homogenies the ingredients in the bowl to create a smooth batter.
meanings.sent2: The goal was to homogenies the data to ensure consistency across all reports.

meanings.definition: A group of similar individuals or things
meanings.sent1: The homogenies of birds chirped in unison in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: The team was a homogenies of talented players from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The homogenies of books on the shelf made it easy to find a specific genre.
